claim: The distribution of retracted articles over the years is shown in Fig. 1.
title: Fig. 1. Retracted publication trend from 2000 to 2022 originating from Turkey.

claim: Of the articles, 14 were case reports, 64 were original research, and 8 were reviews (Fig. 2).
title: Fig. 2. Distribution of retracted publications according to the article type.

claim: The reasons for retraction of the articles were listed as follows: plagiarism (n = 23), duplication (n = 22), error (n = 17), ethical issues (n = 7), fraud (n = 6), author disagreements and conflict (n = 6), unknown (n = 5), and peer review issues (n = 2) (Fig. 3).
title: Fig. 3. Number of articles by reasons for retraction. Multiple reasons are available.

claim: Open in a new tabThe main subject areas of the retracted articles were cardiology (n = 7), obstetrics and gynecology (n = 6), oncology (n = 5), psychiatry (n = 5), anesthesiology (n = 5), and plastic and reconstructive surgery (n = 5) (Fig. 4).
title: Fig. 4. The main subject areas of the retracted publications.

claim: A total of 224 citations were in the pre-retraction period (2.60 citations per article) and 471 citations were in the post-retraction period (5.48 citations per article) (Fig. 5).
title: Fig. 5. Distribution of pre-retraction and post-retraction citations.

claim: The main subject areas of the retracted articles were cardiology (n = 7), obstetrics and gynecology (n = 6), oncology (n = 5), psychiatry (n = 5), anesthesiology (n = 5), and plastic and reconstructive surgery (n = 5) (Fig. 4).
title: Fig. 4. The main subject areas of the retracted publications.
